sentences.sContent: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.sCn: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

sentences.sContent: ...A slow Response to a message could hurt not only your reputation but also your livelihood...
...dongting lake enjoys a good reputation in Chinese culture as the place of origin of dragon boat racing...
...So great is the influence of online ratings that many companies now hire digital reputation managers to ensure a favorable online identity...
...to play down its cosy reputation in favour of something more academic and serious...
...But this is a real-life argument before a Supreme Court that has a well-earned reputation for looking out for the interests of large corporations...
...I know that your company has a great reputation and wonderful product...

phrases.pCn: 由(或通过)名声；由于知名度
vt. 出名因（因…而著称）；有…的好名声

remMethod.val: re(重新) ＋ put(想) ＋ ation(表状态) → 反复想想， 名气只是过眼烟云 → 名气， 名声

words.tran: 声誉好的；受尊敬的；卓越的
名誉好的；被普遍认为…的
认为（repute的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranCn: 名誉， 名气， 名声
trans.tranOther: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past
